Note: User starts with glasses on and connected, battery is 100%. Beginning scavenger hunt activity.
It is a cloudy and grey day outside, slightly windy.
Can see the display on the glasses well. User seemed confused and stumped for a second but when asked said there were no problems or issues.
User stops and stares at a blank wall or the ground to look up the WhatsApp photos.
User took photos of each scavenger hunt photo and sent them using “hey meta” command.
User asks Meta Ai about the surrounding artwork. Meta Ai couldn’t answer. User turned off camera using gesture controls to see if that would help and it did.
User believes that the answers are correct and relevant.

Meta Ai gave a different answer about the same starry night paintings but with different levels of contrast. Called one “starry night painting” and the other “a painting based off of starry night”. User found this interesting that it could distinguish the 2 paintings differently.
User says they “broke the Ai” by asking it about a historical figure. It said “here is what I generated “ but gave no answer.
Meta Ai doesn’t want to switch topics, user asks about a new item they are looking at and meta Ai continues to expand on previous answers.
User did a test question and meta Ai answered “half correctly “ according to participant.

User says visibility of the display is fine but feels the need to turn head towards the display to view it dead on but cannot, as the display also moves. User prefers to have the display in the middle of the eyes, slightly larger.
User interrupted Ai, then when asking Ai to continue Ai responded by playing music on Spotify. User found this amusing.

User asked Ai to name the desert in an image, it responded that there were no desserts in the image but it looks to be a desert landscape. User rephrased question to get a better answer but found previous answer amusing.
User says the glasses ability to “see” what the user is seeing is slightly off. It catches the peripheral rather than what is center of the user’s vision.

User says the glasses view the world in a way that is expanded peripherally, like a camera with its setting on .5x. User has to get really close to an object to get the glasses to catch the correct item the user is asking about.
User says they would use the ask meta feature often in everyday life. “I would ask it a lot of questions about things I pass by” ex. What type of plant is this?
User does believe answers could be better, having more detail.
User keeps gaze mostly straight forward, periodically looking to the ground.
User says the Meta Ai sometimes provides answers with photos, user only pays attention to them sometimes to see if the answer is accurate.
User is going to the restroom.
After previous activity user feels normal, no reported symptoms. No fullness of head as user described having the previous day after study.
User returned from restroom about 2 minutes ago, started setting up for Lego task.
User has experience in tech and Ai, notes they like playing strategy and first person battle games.
User notes Lego building activity indoors was calmer and less distracting than Lego building outdoors.
User wishes display brightness could be brighter outdoors for better visibility.
User can see the Lego pieces well despite them being on a green background.
“The ability to see and work at the same time is easy, easier than using a phone. It is easy to read instructions while building with my hands.”
“Reading blueprints, working on instruction based tasks would be great for it. Anything where you need constant reference to data without having to switch back and forth.”
User notes that glasses would be good for following cooking recipes. There are many ways they could be useful throughout the day.
User says they find a lot of functionality in the glasses but probably wouldn’t wear them for long periods of time. Only wear as needed for a specific purpose, then take them off.
